{"error":"OK","limit":100,"offset":0,"number_of_page_results":17,"number_of_total_results":17,"status_code":1,"results":[{"aliases":"Luna\nLunar","api_detail_url":"https:\/\/www.giantbomb.com\/api\/location\/3035-10\/","date_added":"2008-05-06 17:37:30","date_last_updated":"2018-02-10 15:55:15","deck":"The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite and the fifth largest moon in the Solar System.","description":"

Overview <\/h2>

The Moon, the most easily studied object in the night sky, is also the only extraterrestrial place that any humans have travelled to.<\/p>

The Moon is heavily cratered, the sterile near vacuum of the it's surface preserving even ancient impact sites as if they had only just occurred. The exact age of the moon is hard to determine, but is believed to be around 4.5 billion years. Temperature on the moon can vary from -279\u00b0F (-173\u00b0C) to 242\u00b0F (116\u00b0C). According to scientists, the Moon was formed long ago by a large meteor of some sort crashing into Earth. The debris that flew off into space was caught in Earth's gravitational pull and became our moon. <\/p>

Here on Earth, we can only see one side of the Moon, as it rotates on its axis at the same speed that it revolves around us. Therefore, the same side is always facing at us, with the other side (the famously referred to \"dark side of the moon\") perpetually pointing into the heavens. Also, the Moon is responsible for the tides on Earth by pulling on the water with its own gravitational pull.<\/p>

Humans have long been inspired by the satellite, so it is unsurprising that it has been featured in a number of games, although rarely in a realistic manner. <\/p>

Phases<\/h2>

There are eight different lunar phases. Each phase peaks at a different time. The peak time refers to the time that the moon is highest in the sky. The difference between each peak time is 3 hours, and the moon changes phases every 3 days. As is the case with the sun, the moon rises in the east and sets in the west. Waning means the sun is losing light, waxing means the sun is gaining light.<\/p>

  • Full Moon<\/strong> - Peak Time: 12:00 AM <\/li>
  • Waning Gibbous<\/strong> - Peak Time: 3:00 AM <\/li>
  • Half Moon<\/strong> - Peak Time: 6:00 AM <\/li>
  • Waning Quarter<\/strong> - Peak Time: 9:00 AM <\/li>
  • New Moon<\/strong> - Peak Time: 12:00 PM <\/li>
  • Waxing Quarter<\/strong> - Peak Time: 3:00 PM <\/li>
  • Half Moon<\/strong> - Peak Time: 6:00 PM <\/li>
  • Waxing Gibbous<\/strong> -Peak Time: 9:00 PM <\/li>
  • Full Moon<\/strong> -Peak Time: 12:00 AM<\/li><\/ul>

    In Video Games <\/h2>

    The Moon can be seen in the skybox<\/a> as simple night time decoration in many video games. In those games where it plays a more notable role, the moon is often a sinister being, one that wishes nothing more than to see the end of man.<\/p>

    The orbiting ball of spite in the sky has been fed up with its constant circling around our rock, and it would love nothing more than to see our demise at its metaphorical hands. It has attempted to crush the world of Termina with its immense bulk in The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask<\/a>, and its passing has signified the coming of great beings of power that wish to devour mankind.<\/p>

    There have been those brave enough to attempt fighting back against this menacing beast. Those brave few who have attempted to tame this vile rock include Dr. Ivo \"Eggman\" Robotnik<\/a>, Scrooge McDuck<\/a>, and Sackboy<\/a>. <\/p>

    In most games, the moon serves no real purpose and just sits in the sky. Some games, however, have allowed players to explore the moon. Mass Effect<\/a>, for example, has a side quest where the player must land on the Moon and locate a military base where they are to destroy a rogue virtual intelligence<\/a>.<\/p>

    In Portal 2<\/a>, moon rocks are excellent portal conductors and terribly poisonous. Aperture Science ground them up and made \"conversion gel\", which, when spread on a surface, allows one to place a portal on it.<\/p>","guid":"3035-10","id":10,"image":{"icon_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/square_avatar\/0\/4\/10044-full_moon_large.jpg","medium_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/scale_medium\/0\/4\/10044-full_moon_large.jpg","screen_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/screen_medium\/0\/4\/10044-full_moon_large.jpg","screen_large_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/screen_kubrick\/0\/4\/10044-full_moon_large.jpg","small_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/scale_small\/0\/4\/10044-full_moon_large.jpg","super_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/scale_large\/0\/4\/10044-full_moon_large.jpg","thumb_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/scale_avatar\/0\/4\/10044-full_moon_large.jpg","tiny_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/square_mini\/0\/4\/10044-full_moon_large.jpg","original_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/original\/0\/4\/10044-full_moon_large.jpg","image_tags":"All Images"},"image_tags":[{"api_detail_url":"https:\/\/www.giantbomb.com\/api\/images\/3035-10\/?filter=image_tag%3AAll+Images","name":"All Images","total":4},{"api_detail_url":"https:\/\/www.giantbomb.com\/api\/images\/3035-10\/?filter=image_tag%3AVideo+Game+Moons","name":"Video Game Moons","total":1}],"name":"The Moon","site_detail_url":"https:\/\/www.giantbomb.com\/the-moon\/3035-10\/","first_appeared_in_game":[]},{"aliases":null,"api_detail_url":"https:\/\/www.giantbomb.com\/api\/location\/3035-182\/","date_added":"2008-07-25 00:13:17","date_last_updated":"2011-09-11 05:02:33","deck":"Silvermoon City is located in Eversong Woods, Eastern Kingdoms. It is the capital city for the Blood Elves and is ruled by the Regent Lord of Quel'thalas, Lor'themar Theron.","description":"

    The high elven city of Silvermoon was founded thousands of years ago after their arrival to Lordaeron. During the events of the Third War, the Death Knight Arthas Menethil<\/span> led a force of the undead Scourge into the land to resurrect the fallen necromancer, Kel'Thuzad through the mystical energies of the Sunwell. Arthas' path to Silvermoon is documented by the trail left through the land known as The Dead Scar which stretches from the Ghostlands to Eversong Woods. After the attack by Arthas, the remaining high elves (now calling themselves blood elves) retook Silvermoon City and now reinhabit the area. Today, it is now one of the four major cities allied with the Horde.<\/p>","guid":"3035-182","id":182,"image":{"icon_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/square_avatar\/0\/5434\/1216851-1.jpg","medium_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/scale_medium\/0\/5434\/1216851-1.jpg","screen_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/screen_medium\/0\/5434\/1216851-1.jpg","screen_large_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/screen_kubrick\/0\/5434\/1216851-1.jpg","small_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/scale_small\/0\/5434\/1216851-1.jpg","super_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/scale_large\/0\/5434\/1216851-1.jpg","thumb_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/scale_avatar\/0\/5434\/1216851-1.jpg","tiny_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/square_mini\/0\/5434\/1216851-1.jpg","original_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/original\/0\/5434\/1216851-1.jpg","image_tags":"All Images"},"image_tags":[{"api_detail_url":"https:\/\/www.giantbomb.com\/api\/images\/3035-182\/?filter=image_tag%3AAll+Images","name":"All Images","total":43}],"name":"Silvermoon City","site_detail_url":"https:\/\/www.giantbomb.com\/silvermoon-city\/3035-182\/","first_appeared_in_game":[]},{"aliases":null,"api_detail_url":"https:\/\/www.giantbomb.com\/api\/location\/3035-974\/","date_added":"2008-08-01 17:22:33","date_last_updated":"2011-05-05 12:43:47","deck":"The Moon That Never Sets is the final location you travel to in the game The Legend of Dragoon.     <\/div>The Moon That Never Sets is a mysterious moon around the planet of The Legend of Dragoon. It is a central part in much of a commonly accepted mythology story about the creation of the world and it's inhabitants.In the story, a tree called the Divine Tree grew. From it, every species of life was created, up to 108 species. The humans and Viragos and dragons were among the last species. It was 11,000 years prior to the events of The Legend of Dragoon, when the final species, the God of Destruction Virage Embryo, came to be. It's purpose was to be the ender of all other life. The Winglies, at the time the dominant species, stopped it, and separated it's soul from it's body. That body was cast into the sky, where it became The Moon That Never Sets. The soul was sealed in crystal, and it's power was used by the Winglie leader Melbu Frahma. It ended up getting destroyed, unleashing the spirit into the world, to continuously attempt to reconnect to it's body.Every 108 years, the soul will attempt to make it to it's body, one way or another. In order to bring The Moon That Never Sets down, the soul must destroy all signets holding it up, with the divine moon objects. This gets achieved in spite of the group's best efforts, so the Moon comes down on the Divine Tree. The soul then meets with it's body, and the Virage Embryo is reborn, but Melbu Frahma, at the last second, replaced Shana to harness the power and become the God of Destruction.This is related to the Black Monster as well. The Black Monster was created to appear every 108 years as well, and to destroy the carrier of the soul of the God of Destruction, as well as every nearby soul that could become it's new host. However, the last time the Black Monster appeared, it failed to kill the actual Moon Child, thus resulting in the prophecy being likely to go through.","guid":"3035-974","id":974,"image":{"icon_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/square_avatar\/0\/5322\/448946-moon1.png","medium_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/scale_medium\/0\/5322\/448946-moon1.png","screen_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/screen_medium\/0\/5322\/448946-moon1.png","screen_large_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/screen_kubrick\/0\/5322\/448946-moon1.png","small_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/scale_small\/0\/5322\/448946-moon1.png","super_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/scale_large\/0\/5322\/448946-moon1.png","thumb_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/scale_avatar\/0\/5322\/448946-moon1.png","tiny_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/square_mini\/0\/5322\/448946-moon1.png","original_url":"https:\/\/giantbomb1.cbsistatic.com\/uploads\/original\/0\/5322\/448946-moon1.png","image_tags":"All Images"},"image_tags":[{"api_detail_url":"https:\/\/www.giantbomb.com\/api\/images\/3035-974\/?filter=image_tag%3AAll+Images","name":"All Images","total":4}],"name":"The Moon That Never Sets","site_detail_url":"https:\/\/www.giantbomb.com\/the-moon-that-never-sets\/3035-974\/","first_appeared_in_game":null},{"aliases":null,"api_detail_url":"https:\/\/www.giantbomb.com\/api\/location\/3035-1169\/","date_added":"2008-08-08 09:02:33","date_last_updated":"2011-05-05 12:43:32","deck":"Blue Moon is the homeland of Olaf, Sasha, Colin, and Grit.
